details.content: CLICK HERE FOR EARLIER UPDATES

details.title: TSRTC buses in Hyderabad, interstate services to Karnataka, Maharashtra resumes today
details.content: Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) buses in Hyderabad that were off roads for last six months, along with inter-state services to Karnataka and Maharashtra, will resume services from Friday. Transport Minister Puvvada Ajay Kumar announced on Thursday that 25 per cent of the total 2,800 buses at 29 depots in Greater Hyderabad limits will resume operations.

details.title: Over one lakh coronavirus tests per million in Andhra Pradesh
details.content: Andhra Pradesh achieved a landmark as its number of tests conducted per million population crossed the 1 lakh-mark on Thursday. AP is followed by Tamil Nadu with more than 87,000 tests per million population. Delhi and Jammu and Kashmir (Union Territories) have already achieved the feat.(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Singing legend SP Balasubrahmanyam extremely critical, on 'maximal life support'
details.content: A health bulletin issued by the MGM Healthcare Hospital, where he had been admitted for treatment since August 5, said Balasubrahmanyam remains on ECMO and other life support measures.(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Mizoram reports 26 new cases
details.content:
Mizoram reported 26 new #COVID19 cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total cases in the state to 1786, including 1105 discharges. Active cases stand at 681: Department of Information and Public Relations, Government of Mizoram pic.twitter.com/t5vByLp9sC

— ANI (@ANI) September 25, 2020

details.title: More than 13.8 lakh tests done in last 24 hours
details.content:
India climbs another historic peak of more than 13 lakh tests. More than 13.80 lakh tests done in the last 24 hours: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Government of India. #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/yMwU0bPMtN

— ANI (@ANI) September 25, 2020

details.title: Phase-3 trial of COVAXIN to begin in UP's Lucknow, Gorakhpur from October
details.content:
he Uttar Pradesh government on Thursday announced that phase-3 trial of the coronavirus vaccine 'COVAXIN' will start in Lucknow and Gorakhpur from October.

"The phase-3 trial of COVAXIN being developed by Bharat Biotech will start in Lucknow and Gorakhpur from October," said Uttar Pradesh Principal Health Secretary Amit Mohan Prasad here in a press conference.

details.title: India tally crosses 58-lakh mark with spike of 86,052 new cases, 1141 deaths
details.content:
India's #COVID19 case tally crosses 58-lakh mark with a spike of 86,052 new cases & 1,141 deaths in last 24 hours.

The total case tally stands at 58,18,571 including 9,70,116 active cases, 47,56,165 cured/discharged/migrated & 92,290 deaths: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare pic.twitter.com/MQbENGXCxF

— ANI (@ANI) September 25, 2020

details.title: Andaman caseload rises by 32 to 3744
details.content:
#COVID19 caseload of Andaman and Nicobar Islands climbs to 3,744 with 32 more people testing positive; number of active cases now 189: Health official

— Press Trust of India (@PTI_News) September 25, 2020

details.title: UK plans human challenge studies for Covid vaccine; India says no to the idea
details.content: The UK has become the first country in the world to announce that it will host human challenge studies, in which participants are deliberately injected with a pathogen to assess if a certain vaccine works, for Covid-19 vaccines. This is a proposition that India has considered but chosen not to follow, said senior officials in Union Health Ministry and the ICMR. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: West Bengal Transport Minister Suvendu Adhikari tests COVID-19 positive: Official
details.content:
West Bengal Transport Minister Suvendu Adhikari has tested positive for COVID-19 and is under home isolation, a health official said on Friday.

The minister's mother has also contracted the disease, he said.

The 49-year-old legislator from Nandigram in Purba Medinipur district has isolated himself at a guest house in his constituency, while his mother has been admitted to a Kolkata-based hospital, the official sai

details.title: Jharkhand report 1349 fresh cases, 283 people test positive in Arunachal
details.content:
• Jharkhand's tally rises to 76,438 with detection of 1,349 fresh cases, 4 more deaths raise toll to 652; active case count 12,841
  • 283 more people, including 19 security personnel and 4 healthcare workers, test positive in Arunachal Pradesh, pushing tally to 8,416; number of active cases stands at 2,331

details.title: Jharkhand report 1349 fresh cases, 283 people test positive in Arunachal
details.content:
• Jharkhand's tally rises to 76,438 with detection of 1,349 fresh cases, 4 more deaths raise toll to 652; active case count 12,841
  • 283 more people, including 19 security personnel and 4 healthcare workers, test positive in Arunachal Pradesh, pushing tally to 8,416; number of active cases stands at 2,331

details.title: Odisha's COVID-19 tally crosses 2-lakh mark
details.content:
Odisha's COVID-19 tally crosses 2 lakh-mark with 4,208 new cases; 15 fresh fatalities push death toll to 767: Health official

— Press Trust of India (@PTI_News) September 25, 2020

details.title: Singer SP Balasubrahmanyam has passed away, confirms son Saran
details.content: Singer SP Balasubrahmanyam passed away at 1.04 pm, confirms son Saran. The singer was admitted to a private hospital in Chennai on August 5 after testing positive for coronavirus.

details.title: India mourns loss of SPB
details.content:
??#RIPSPB | Nation mourns the loss of legendary playback singer SP Balasubrahmanyam, who was hospitalised for nearly two months at a hospital in Chennai, after testing positive for #COVID19. For more details ????@xpresstn @gsvasu_TNIE @indulgexpress https://t.co/rSavpSYTo2

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) September 25, 2020

details.title: Arjun Rampal tests negative for COVID-19
details.content: Actor Arjun Rampal, who is in home quarantine after his co-actors from "Nail Polish" tested positive for COVID-19, on Friday said that the result of his test has come out negative. (READ MORE)

details.title: COVID-19 patients to be allowed to cast votes in Bihar
details.content: COVID-19 patients who're quarantined will be able to cast their vote at the last hour of the day of poll, at their respective polling stations, under the supervision of health authorities. This is beside the option of postal facility already extended to them: CEC. (READ MORE)

details.title: Ladakh reports 39 more cases
details.content: Thirty-six more COVID-19 cases were reported in Ladakh on Thursday, taking the total number of active cases to 1,022, according to the Department of Health here. The recovery rate stands at 73 per cent with 2,893 cured patients so far.

details.title: Nearly seven crore tests conducted in India so far
details.content: A record 14,92,409 tests have been conducted for detection of COVID-19 in a span of 24 hours, taking the total tests done so far in the country to nearly 7 crore, while the national cumulative positivity rate stands at 8.44 per cent, the Union Health Ministry said on Friday. (READ MORE)

details.title: Ayush Min to take up clinical study on potential of Vasa, Guduchi for COVID-19
details.content: The Ministry of AYUSH has approved a proposal for carrying out a clinical study to assess the role of Vasa and Guduchi in therapeutic management of symptoms in COVID-19 positive patients.

details.title: Ensure antigen- patients are retested using RT-PCR method: Delhi govt
details.content: The Delhi government has asked all districts to retest all symptomatic patients, who have tested negative for COVID-19 on rapid antigen test, using the more reliable RT-PCR method, after it found the process was not followed in over 1,400 cases.

details.title: Odisha minister tests positive for COVID-19
details.content:
I have tested COVID positive today. Hence I request all my friends and associates who came in contact with me in last 7 days to test & isolate themselves.#StaySafe

— Tusharkanti Behera (@btushar02) September 25, 2020

details.title: 281 more Maharashtra cops test positive for COVID-19
details.content: 281 police personnel tested positive for COVID-19 and 4 died in the last 24 hours, taking total cases to 22,269 in the force including 18,711 recoveries, 3,319 active cases and 239 deaths: Maharashtra Police

details.title: Mortal remains of singer SPB brought to his residence
details.content:
Tamil Nadu: Mortal remains of singer SP Balasubrahmanyam brought to his residence in Chennai.

SP Balasubrahmanyam passed away at a hospital in the city, earlier today. pic.twitter.com/z7gKvv5k0w

— ANI (@ANI) September 25, 2020

details.title: Kerala registers highest one-spike in cases
details.content: Kerala on Friday recorded 6477 fresh cases and 22 deaths. The state now has 48, 892 active patients.

details.title: Cases in Chennai rise with 1193 fresh cases
details.content:
5,679 persons tested positive for COVID-19 in Tamil Nadu on Friday taking the state tally to 5,69,370.

  • Fresh cases in Chennai: 1,193
  • Total cases in Chennai: 1,60,926
  • Fresh deaths in Tamil Nadu: 72
  • Total deaths in Tamil Nadu: 9,148
  • Active cases: 46,386

details.title: Plasma therapy has been administered to Manish Sisodia
details.content: Plasma therapy has been administered to Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia who is suffering from dengue and COVID-19 at Max hospital, Saket. He was shifted from Lok Nayak Jayaprakash Hospital to Max hospital yesterday, said the Office of Deputy CM

details.title: Maharashtra govt to issue circular for rational use of remdesivir
details.content: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Friday said the state government will issue circular within 24 hours to all doctors and COVID-19 hospitals for rational use of remdesivir injections in the treatment of coronavirus infection. (READ MORE)

details.title: Telangana permits reopening bars, clubs, tourism bars
details.content: As part of the 'unlock' phase, the Telangana government on Friday permitted reopening bars, clubs and tourism bars with immediate effect and prescribed conditions to be followed which include provision of thermal screening at entrance of bar and hand sanitizers.

details.title: Uttar Pradesh??????? records 4,519 fresh COVID-19 cases, 84 deaths; infection tally at 3,78,533
details.content: Uttar Pradesh reported 4,519 fresh coronavirus cases on Friday, taking the infection tally to 3,78,533, while 84 more deaths pushed the toll to 5,450, officials said. Lucknow, the state capital, reported the maximum number of fresh cases and deaths.

details.title: Jammu and Kashmir reports 1,218 fresh COVID-19 cases, 21 deaths
details.content: As many as 1,218 fresh COVID-19 cases took Jammu and Kashmir's infection tally to 69,832 on Friday, while 21 more fatalities pushed the death toll to 1,105, officials said. The union territory has reported more than 1,000 fresh cases for 23 consecutive days now.

details.title: Odisha Sports Minister Tusharkanti Behera tests COVID-positive
details.content: Odisha Sports and Youth Services Minister Tusharkanti Behera said on Friday that he was diagnosed with COVID-19 and urged all those who came in contact with him to get tested. Behera said that he has some symptoms and is in home isolation. (READ MORE)

details.title: Meghalaya records highest single day recovery
details.content: Meghalaya on Friday recorded the highest single-day recovery of 285 COVID-19 patients, taking the total number of people cured of the disease to 3,343, a senior health department official said. Meanwhile, 80 new cases pushed the state's COVID-19 tally to 5,158, Health Services director Aman War said.

details.title: Maharashtra COVID-19 tally crosses 13 lakh-mark with 17,794 fresh cases in last 24-hours
details.content: Maharashtra's COVID-19 tally rose to 13,00,757 on Friday with the single-day addition of 17,794 cases, the state health department said. Due to the death of 416 patients during the day, the fatality count in the state mounted to 34,761, it said. (READ MORE)

details.title: 519 COVID-19 cases, three deaths in Goa, 724 discharged
details.content: Goa reported 519 COVID-19 cases and three deaths from the infection on Friday, taking the coastal state's count to 31,071 and toll to 386, while 724 people were discharged from hospitals during the day, an official said. The number of people who have recovered now stands at 25,071, leaving the state with 5,614 active cases, he added.

details.title: 8655 new COVID-19 cases and 86 deaths reported in Karnataka
details.content:
8655 new #COVID19 cases & 86 deaths reported in Karnataka till Thursday midnight. 4080 cases from Bengaluru alone. pic.twitter.com/wGrv1jmMtP

— Anusha Ravi Sood (@anusharavi10) September 25, 2020

details.title: 3,827 fresh COVID-19 cases take Delhi's tally past 2.64 lakh
details.content: Delhi recorded 3,827 fresh coronavirus cases on Friday, taking its caseload to over 2.64 lakh, while 24 fatalities pushed the death toll to 5,147, authorities said. The city's infection tally stands at 2,64,450, while there are 30,867 active cases.

details.title: 1,930 COVID-19 positive cases were reported in Punjab today
details.content:
A total of 1930, COVID-19 positive cases were reported today in Punjab, taking the state’s total tally to 1,07,096 cases, while 84,025 discharged/recovered and 3134 have died till date#Pb @Newindianxpress, @SundayStandard, @TheMornStandard

— Harpreet Singh Bajwa (@Harpreet_TNIE) September 25, 2020

details.title: 217 cases, 3 deaths in Maharashtra's Amravati, 313 discharged
details.content: Amravati in Maharashtra reported 217 new COVID-19 cases on Friday, but the silver lining was 313 people getting discharged during the day, an official said. The district's tally now is 12,233 while three deaths took the toll to 262, he added.

details.title: 928 more test positive for COVID-19 in Uttarakhand
details.content: As many as 928 people tested positive for COVID-19 in Uttarakhand on Friday, taking the state's caseload to 45,332, while 13 more people died of the disease across the state.

details.title: Record 1,442 new coronavirus cases in Gujarat, 12 deaths
details.content: Gujarat recorded its highest single-day spike of 1,442 coronavirus cases on Friday, raising the case tally to 1,30,391, the state health department said. With 12 fatalities, the COVID-19 death toll in the state increased to 3,396, it added.

details.title: 38 new cases push Nagaland's COVID-19 tally to 5,768
details.content: At least 38 more persons tested positive for COVID-19 in Nagaland on Friday, taking the tally in the state to 5,768, Health and Family Welfare Additional Director Dr Denis Hangsing said.

details.title: Rajasthan records 2,010 fresh COVID-19 cases, 15 deaths
details.content: Rajasthan reported its highest single-day spike of 2,010 coronavirus cases on Friday while the state's death toll due to the infection rose to 1,412 with 15 more fatalities, according to a health department bulletin. The total number of people infected with COVID-19 rose 1,24,730 in Rajasthan.

details.title: Surat's COVID case count grows by 300, death toll by two
details.content: Surat reported 300 new coronavirus positive cases on Friday, taking the district's overall tally to 26,715, Gujarat health department said. This is the biggest one-day growth registered on Friday in terms of the number of cases for any district in the state.

details.title: Kin of 3 deceased health workers in J-K given assistance under Centre's insurance scheme
details.content: The families of two doctors and a healthcare worker from Jammu and Kashmir, who died due to COVID-19 contracted while on duty, have been provided assistance under a central government scheme to grant an insurance cover of Rs 50 lakh, officials said on Friday.

details.title: 68 more deaths, 1,930 fresh cases in Punjab
details.content: Punjab reported 68 more deaths due to COVID-19 on Friday, pushing the death toll to 3,134, while 1,930 fresh cases took the infection tally to 1,07,096. Eleven deaths were reported from Amritsar, eight from Hoshiarpur, seven from Ludhiana, six each from Bathinda and Jalandhar and five from Fazilka, as per a medical bulletin.

details.title: Private ???????hospitals in 6 district headquarters to reserve 30% beds for COVID patients: Rajasthan government
details.content: Amid rising cases of the coronavirus in Rajasthan, the state government on Friday asked private hospitals located at six district headquarters to reserve 30 per cent beds for COVID-19 patients. Principal Secretary for Health Akhil Arora issued an order to this effect on Friday.

details.title: 84 more contract coronavirus in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar
details.content: Eighty-four more people, including six police personnel and four jail inmates, contracted coronavirus in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Friday, an official said. According to District Magistrate Selva Kumari J, results of 966 sample were received, of which 84 were found positive.

details.title: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar warns hospitals on overcharging virus patients
details.content: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said stringent action will be taken against hospitals overcharging COVID-19 patients. At a review meeting here, Pawar, who is guardian minister of Pune, asked local officials to implement the state government's 'my family, my responsibility' anti-COVID-19 drive efficiently.

details.title: 182 new coronavirus cases in Ahmedabad, three deaths
details.content: Coronavirus cases in Ahmedabad district rose to 35,853 with 182 new cases being reported on Friday, the Gujarat health department said. The district reported three fatalities, raising the COVID-19 death toll to 1,813, it added.

details.title: Mumbai reports 1,876 new COVID-19 cases, 48 patients die
details.content: With 1,876 people testing positive for COVID-19 on Friday, Mumbai's infection count reached 1,94,177, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. The death toll due to the virus in the country's financial capital rose to 8,703 with 48 new fatalities, it said.

details.title: One death, 244 new COVID cases in Chandigarh
details.content: One more person died from coronavirus in Chandigarh on Friday as 244 new cases surfaced, pushing the infection count to 11,212 in the joint capital of Punjab and Haryana. So far, 145 people have succumbed to the disease in the union territory, a medical bulletin said.

details.title: One more COVID-19 fatality in Noida, death toll 51
details.content: Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddh Nagar recorded one more COVID-19 fatality on Friday that pushed the district's death toll to 51, official data showed. Another 242 people tested positive for coronavirus that took the district's case tally to 12,253, according to the data released by the UP Health Department for a 24-hour period.

details.title: Nagpur sees 971 new COVID-19 cases; 41 more deaths
details.content: As many as 971 persons tested for coronavirus, while 41 died of the infection in Maharashtra's Nagpur district on Friday, an official said. The latest cases have taken the tally in the district to 72,899, the official said.

details.title: 2,227 new coronavirus cases in Madhya Pradesh, 30 deaths
details.content: Madhya Pradesh on Friday reported 2,227 new coronavirus cases, pushing its case count to 1,17,588, the health departmentsaid. The death toll in the state due to the pandemic went up to 2,152 with 30 fatalities in the past 24 hours, it said in a statement in the evening.

details.title: Nashik records 1,468 new COVID-19 cases; tally crosses 70,000
details.content: With the addition of 1,468 fresh infections on Friday, the COVID-19 caseload in Maharashtra's Nashik district has risen to 70,297, an official said. Apart from this, 26 patients died of the infection in the district, taking the toll to 1,275, the official said.

details.title: Bihar reports three more COVID deaths, 1,632 fresh cases
details.content: Three more people died due to COVID-19 in Bihar, raising the death toll in the state to 881, while 1,632 fresh cases pushed the tally to 1,75,897, a health department bulletin said on Friday.

details.title: 293 fresh COVID-19 cases take Himachal Pradesh's tally to 13,680; death toll 153
details.content: The COVID-19 death toll in Himachal Pradesh rose to 153 on Friday with seven more fatalities, while 293 fresh cases took the infection tally in the state to 13,680, according to health department data.
